## Confidence interval 3

```{r cars}
alpha = 0.1
instance <- function(n) {
  data = rpois(n, 1)
  m = mean(data)
  z = qnorm(1-alpha/2)
  return(m-z*sqrt(m/n) <= 1 & 1 <= m+z*sqrt(m/n))
}
sum(replicate(10000, instance(30)))/10000
sum(replicate(10000, instance(100)))/10000
```

fraction is (naturally) about 90 %.
